greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of partitions of n containing no part i of multiplicity i.
comment: The Heinz numbers of these partitions are given by A325130. - _Gus Wiseman_, Apr 02 2019
link: Vaclav Kotesovec, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..12782 (terms 0..5000 from Alois P. Heinz)
example: a(4) = 3 because we have [1,1,1,1], [1,1,2], and [4]; the partitions [1,3], [2,2] do not qualify.
maple: g := product(1/(1-x^i)-x^(i^2), i = 1 .. 100): gser := series(g, x = 0, 53): seq(coeff(gser, x, n), n = 0 .. 50);
mathematica: b[n_, i_] := b[n, i] = Expand[If[n == 0, 1, If[i < 1, 0, Sum[If[i == j, x, 1]*b[n - i*j, i - 1], {j, 0, n/i}]]]]; T[n_] := Function[p, Table[Coefficient[p, x, i], {i, 0, Exponent[p, x]}]][b[n, n]]; Table[T[n][[1]], {n, 0, 60}] (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Nov 28 2016 after _Alois P. Heinz_'s Maple code for A276427 *)
results.author: _Emeric Deutsch_, Sep 19 2016
